Title: Beginner's Guide to Jujutsu Kaisen! | Featured News | Tokyo Otaku Mode (TOM) Shop: Figures & Merch From Japan
Data: Tokyo Otaku ModeShopNewsGalleryOtapediaLog InSign UpFEATUREDANIMEMANGAMOVIEEVENTFIGUREARTCOSPLAYJAPANHOW TOFASHIONPRODUCTGAMEMUSICPRESS RELEASEBeginner's Guide to Jujutsu Kaisen!FEATUREDMar. 4, 2021 09:20High school student Yuji Itadori is just a regular kid, if you don’t count his amazing strength, supernatural speed, the fact that he ate a cursed finger… Alright, scratch that. Of course he’s nowhere near normal – he’s the hero of  Jujutsu Kaisen (呪術廻戦, Jujutsu Kaisen), a dark fantasy manga by Gege Akutami (芥見下々, Akutami Gege) with a 24-episode anime series by MAPPA. Set in a world where sorcerers must fight deadly curses born of negative emotions,  Jujutsu Kaisen combines its dark premise with a refreshing modern setting, relatable characters and of course, plenty of action. Read on to learn more about the world of  Jujutsu Kaisen, along with its characters, keywords and more! Contents1. Story2. Setting3. Characters- 3.1 Jujutsu High students- 3.2 Jujutsu High faculty- 3.3 Antagonists4. Keywords5. Main media- 5.1 Manga- 5.2 TV anime series- 5.3 Anime film StoryDespite being blessed with extraordinary athleticism, fifteen-year-old Yuji Itadori refuses to have anything to do with his high school’s track team. His choice? The Occult Research Club. However, his world is thrown into chaos when a cursed talisman in the form of a rotting finger is unsealed at school. To protect his friends, Yuji swallows the finger, which is actually a fragment of legendary "King of Curses" Ryomen Sukuna, and becomes possessed himself. Although this effectively signs his death warrant, the intervention of powerful sorcerer Satoru Gojo sets him on a different path: to consume the rest of Sukuna’s fingers so he can destroy the curse – and himself – forever.  SettingTo be human is to experience not only positive feelings, but also negative emotions like sadness, regret and shame. In  Jujutsu Kaisen, such emotions produce cursed energy, which transforms into curses that can bring misfortune to the world. While normal humans cannot control this, Jujutsu Sorcerers are able to harness their own cursed energy to use certain techniques. With their supernatural powers, these sorcerers secretly protect humans from curses and the threats they pose to society. Characters – Jujutsu High studentsYuji Itadori (虎杖 悠仁, Itadori Yūji)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA fifteen-year-old with extraordinary athleticism. Good-natured and always willing to help those around him, Yuji particularly values the importance of life and having a “fair death”, which was instilled in him by his dead grandfather. As a result, he eats Sukuna’s finger to save his friends and thus becomes the present-day vessel of the “King of Curses.” He then enrolls in Jujutsu High to become a sorcerer himself under the tutelage of Satoru Gojo. Through lessons and missions, he learns more about cursed energy and how to control it, boosting his already impressive physical abilities. He is voiced by Junya Enoki (Japanese) and Adam McArthur (English). Megumi Fushiguro (伏黒恵, Fushiguro Megumi)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA first-year student. Megumi’s search for a cursed object leads him to meet Yuji and witness his self-sacrifice first-hand, despite them being strangers. Secretive and calculating, he nevertheless believes in helping those who are good and kind, as seen when he vouches for Yuji in the face of the latter’s impending execution. The two are later reunited as fellow students under the tutelage of Satoru Gojo. Megumi’s sorcery talents include summoning Shikigami (spirits) for offense and exorcisms. He is voiced by Yuma Uchida (Japanese) and Robbie Daymond (English).Nobara Kugisaki (釘崎野薔薇, Kugisaki Nobara)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA first-year student hailing from the country. As one of Satoru’s students, she teams up with Yuji and Megumi for various missions. Self-confident and quick to speak her mind, she takes pride in her own identity, abilities and appearance. Nobara’s distinctive battle style includes the use of hammers and nails infused with cursed energy.  She is voiced by Asami Seto (Japanese) and Anne Yatco (English).Maki Zen'in (禪院真希, Zen'in Maki)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA second-year student who participates in the event with their sister school in Kyoto. Despite being born to a clan of elite Jujutsu Sorcerers, Maki doesn't have the ability to control cursed energy or even see curses. However, she compensates for this with amazing physical strength and talent with all sorts of cursed tools. She is voiced by Mikako Komatsu (Japanese) and Allegra Clark (English).Toge Inumaki (狗巻棘, Inumaki Toge)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA second-year student who participates in the sister school event. His power is channeled through cursed speech – words imbued with his cursed energy. To ensure that his abilities don't affect people in everyday situations, he only uses words that can be fillings for rice balls. He is voiced by Koki Uchiyama (Japanese) and Xander Mobus (English).Panda (パンダ, Panda)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA second-year student who participates in the sister school event with Maki and Toge. Despite his appearance as a full-sized panda, he can speak like a human and is also an exceptionally powerful sorcerer. He is voiced by Tomokazu Seki (Japanese) and Matthew David Rudd (English). – Jujutsu High facultySatoru Gojo (五条悟, Gojō Satoru)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA powerful sorcerer and teacher who mentors Yuji, Megumi and Nobara. After Yuji is sentenced to death for being possessed by Sukuna, Satoru proposes that they wait until all of the fingers are consumed, which would give them the chance to destroy Sukuna once and for all. He is renowned for his immense power and battle prowess to the point that his self-proclamation of being the world’s strongest Jujutsu Sorcerer goes unchallenged. He is voiced by Yuichi Nakamura (Japanese) and Kaiji Tang (English).Masamichi Yaga (夜蛾正道, Yaga Masamichi)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteJujutsu High's principal and a passionate educator who once mentored Gojo. He has the ability to bring dolls to life and control them through his cursed corpse technique. He is voiced by Takaya Kuroda (Japanese) and Keith Silverstein (English). – AntagonistsRyomen Sukuna (両面宿儺, Ryōmen Sukuna)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA legendary curse inhabiting Yuji’s body. Also translated as "Double Faced Specter." Known as the "King of Curses", Sukuna resisted all exorcism attempts, driving sorcerers of centuries ago to cut off and hide his 20 fingers in order to seal his power. His character has roots in Japanese legend, with references to a two-faced, 8-armed and 8-legged man with supernatural strength in Nihon Shoki, the second oldest book of Japanese history. He is voiced by Junichi Suwabe (Japanese), and Ray Chase (English).Suguru Geto (夏油 傑, Getō Suguru)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA Special Grade Jujutsu Sorcerer who wishes to transform the world into a "paradise" that would house sorcerers only. He is voiced by Takahiro Sakurai (Japanese) and Lex Lang (English).Jogo (漏瑚, Jōgo)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA powerful curse born of fear of the earth. He believes that his own kind is humanity's true form because cursed spirits originate from pure emotion, as opposed to humans and their false emotions. He is voiced by Shigeru Chiba (Japanese) and Michael Sorich (English).Hanami (花御, Hanami)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA powerful curse born of fear of the forests. They wish to eliminate humans so they stop hurting the environment. They are voiced by Atsuko Tanaka. Keywords – Curses (呪い, noroi) / Cursed Spirits (呪霊, jurei) Spiritual beings given form by cursed energy (see below). Particularly likely to manifest in places like hospitals and schools, they are the cause of countless mysterious deaths and disappearances in general society, with regular people unable to see them. However, Jujutsu Sorcerers are able to see, fight and exorcise them. Curses vary greatly in appearance and power, and are ranked by strength with Grades 1-4 (4 being the weakest) and Special Grade (the very strongest). They may also be sealed in artifacts as Sukuna was, becoming cursed objects (呪物, jubutsu) that can still emit cursed energy.  – Cursed Energy (呪力, juryoku)A form of energy that arises from humans’ negative emotions, like hate, regret, and shame, and gives form to curses. While regular people are unable to control it, Jujutsu Sorcerers (see below) and curses are able to harness their own cursed energy for combat.  – Jujutsu Sorcerer (呪術師, jujutsu-shi)Individuals who have been trained to combat curses using Jujutsu spells and techniques at one of Japan’s two recognized Jujutsu educational institutions. They are tasked with various missions, the difficulty of which should match their grade as a sorcerer, with Grade 4 being the lowest and Special Grade being the highest. These duties may involve exorcising curses, investigating curse-related incidents, and so on.  – Tokyo Prefectural Jujutsu High School (東京都立呪術高等専門学校, Tōkyo Toritsu Jujutsu Senmon Gakkō)A 4-year institution where aspiring Jujutsu Sorcerers gather to train their craft. It can also be translated as Tokyo Metropolitan Magic Technical School and abbreviated as Jujutsu High. One of Japan’s only two Jujutsu schools, it is located in the suburbs of Tokyo, with the other (its sister school) located in Kyoto. However, it is disguised as a religious school and is further hidden and protected from outside threats by a protective barrier. It is common for fully-fledged sorcerers to come back to Jujutsu High to teach students, as well as manage and support missions. Main media MangaSource: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteWritten and illustrated by Gege Akutami,  Jujutsu Kaisen first began serialization in  Weekly Shonen Jump in March 2018. Before this, however, a 4-chapter series titled Tokyo Metropolitan Curse Technical School ran in Jump GIGA. Featuring a different main character named Yuta, it was published as a single volume titled  Jujutsu Kaisen 0. Still ongoing with 15 volumes as of March 2021, the main series is one of the best-selling manga series of all time. Over 30 million copies are in circulation (including digital releases) as of February 2021. English translations are currently available online through Shueisha’s Manga Plus app and website. It's also been released in print for North America through Viz Media. Get a peek at the manga here! TV Anime SeriesThe MAPPA-produced anime series debuted in Japan on October 3, 2020 and is slated to run for 24 episodes over two seasons. Directed by Sunghoo Park and written by Hiroshi Seko, it covers the manga's story up to roughly Volume 7. For countries outside of Asia,  Jujutsu Kaisen is available to stream through Crunchyroll. Check out the first episode below!As well as dynamic animation, there are also four theme songs to enjoy: "Kaikai Kitan" by Eve (first opening theme), "Lost in Paradise feat. AKLO" by ALI (first ending theme), "Vivid Vice" by Who-ya Extended (second opening theme), and "Give it Back" by Cö Shu Nie (second ending theme). Get started with "Kaikai Kitan" below! Anime FilmMAPPA is producing an anime film titled  Gekijoban Jujutsu Kaisen 0 ( Jujutsu Kaisen 0: The Movie ). Set for release in winter 2021, the film's story will be based on Tokyo Metropolitan Curse Technical School, the 4-chapter prequel series that was also published in a volume as  Jujutsu Kaisen 0.Source: Jujutsu Kaisen film's official websiteFeel like a bigger taste of  Jujutsu Kaisen? Sit down, maybe get yourself a (hopefully non-finger shaped) snack, and head on your first mission with Yuji! It is common for fully-fledged sorcerers to come back to Jujutsu High to teach students, as well as manage and support missions. Main media MangaSource: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteWritten and illustrated by Gege Akutami,  Jujutsu Kaisen first began serialization in  Weekly Shonen Jump in March 2018. Before this, however, a 4-chapter series titled Tokyo Metropolitan Curse Technical School ran in Jump GIGA. Featuring a different main character named Yuta, it was published as a single volume titled  Jujutsu Kaisen 0. Still ongoing with 15 volumes as of March 2021, the main series is one of the best-selling manga series of all time. Over 30 million copies are in circulation (including digital releases) as of February 2021. English translations are currently available online through Shueisha’s Manga Plus app and website. It's also been released in print for North America through Viz Media. Get a peek at the manga here! TV Anime SeriesThe MAPPA-produced anime series debuted in Japan on October 3, 2020 and is slated to run for 24 episodes over two seasons. Directed by Sunghoo Park and written by Hiroshi Seko, it covers the manga's story up to roughly Volume 7. For countries outside of Asia,  Jujutsu Kaisen is available to stream through Crunchyroll. Check out the first episode below!As well as dynamic animation, there are also four theme songs to enjoy: "Kaikai Kitan" by Eve (first opening theme), "Lost in Paradise feat. AKLO" by ALI (first ending theme), "Vivid Vice" by Who-ya Extended (second opening theme), and "Give it Back" by Cö Shu Nie (second ending theme). Get started with "Kaikai Kitan" below! Anime FilmMAPPA is producing an anime film titled  Gekijoban Jujutsu Kaisen 0 ( Jujutsu Kaisen 0: The Movie ). Set for release in winter 2021, the film's story will be based on Tokyo Metropolitan Curse Technical School, the 4-chapter prequel series that was also published in a volume as  Jujutsu Kaisen 0.Source: Jujutsu Kaisen film's official websiteFeel like a bigger taste of  Jujutsu Kaisen? Sit down, maybe get yourself a (hopefully non-finger shaped) snack, and head on your first mission with Yuji! Title: Beginner's Guide to Jujutsu Kaisen! | Featured News | Tokyo Otaku Mode (TOM) Shop: Figures & Merch From Japan
Data: Beginner's Guide to Jujutsu Kaisen!FEATUREDMar. 4, 2021 09:20High school student Yuji Itadori is just a regular kid, if you don’t count his amazing strength, supernatural speed, the fact that he ate a cursed finger… Alright, scratch that. Of course he’s nowhere near normal – he’s the hero of  Jujutsu Kaisen (呪術廻戦, Jujutsu Kaisen), a dark fantasy manga by Gege Akutami (芥見下々, Akutami Gege) with a 24-episode anime series by MAPPA. Set in a world where sorcerers must fight deadly curses born of negative emotions,  Jujutsu Kaisen combines its dark premise with a refreshing modern setting, relatable characters and of course, plenty of action. Read on to learn more about the world of  Jujutsu Kaisen, along with its characters, keywords and more! Contents1. Story2. Setting3. Characters- 3.1 Jujutsu High students- 3.2 Jujutsu High faculty- 3.3 Antagonists4. Keywords5. Main media- 5.1 Manga- 5.2 TV anime series- 5.3 Anime film StoryDespite being blessed with extraordinary athleticism, fifteen-year-old Yuji Itadori refuses to have anything to do with his high school’s track team. His choice? The Occult Research Club. However, his world is thrown into chaos when a cursed talisman in the form of a rotting finger is unsealed at school. To protect his friends, Yuji swallows the finger, which is actually a fragment of legendary "King of Curses" Ryomen Sukuna, and becomes possessed himself. Although this effectively signs his death warrant, the intervention of powerful sorcerer Satoru Gojo sets him on a different path: to consume the rest of Sukuna’s fingers so he can destroy the curse – and himself – forever.  SettingTo be human is to experience not only positive feelings, but also negative emotions like sadness, regret and shame. In  Jujutsu Kaisen, such emotions produce cursed energy, which transforms into curses that can bring misfortune to the world. While normal humans cannot control this, Jujutsu Sorcerers are able to harness their own cursed energy to use certain techniques. With their supernatural powers, these sorcerers secretly protect humans from curses and the threats they pose to society. Characters – Jujutsu High studentsYuji Itadori (虎杖 悠仁, Itadori Yūji)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA fifteen-year-old with extraordinary athleticism. Good-natured and always willing to help those around him, Yuji particularly values the importance of life and having a “fair death”, which was instilled in him by his dead grandfather. As a result, he eats Sukuna’s finger to save his friends and thus becomes the present-day vessel of the “King of Curses.” He then enrolls in Jujutsu High to become a sorcerer himself under the tutelage of Satoru Gojo. Through lessons and missions, he learns more about cursed energy and how to control it, boosting his already impressive physical abilities. He is voiced by Junya Enoki (Japanese) and Adam McArthur (English). Megumi Fushiguro (伏黒恵, Fushiguro Megumi)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA first-year student. Megumi’s search for a cursed object leads him to meet Yuji and witness his self-sacrifice first-hand, despite them being strangers. Secretive and calculating, he nevertheless believes in helping those who are good and kind, as seen when he vouches for Yuji in the face of the latter’s impending execution. The two are later reunited as fellow students under the tutelage of Satoru Gojo. Megumi’s sorcery talents include summoning Shikigami (spirits) for offense and exorcisms. He is voiced by Yuma Uchida (Japanese) and Robbie Daymond (English).Nobara Kugisaki (釘崎野薔薇, Kugisaki Nobara)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA first-year student hailing from the country. As one of Satoru’s students, she teams up with Yuji and Megumi for various missions. Self-confident and quick to speak her mind, she takes pride in her own identity, abilities and appearance. Nobara’s distinctive battle style includes the use of hammers and nails infused with cursed energy.  She is voiced by Asami Seto (Japanese) and Anne Yatco (English).Maki Zen'in (禪院真希, Zen'in Maki)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA second-year student who participates in the event with their sister school in Kyoto. Despite being born to a clan of elite Jujutsu Sorcerers, Maki doesn't have the ability to control cursed energy or even see curses. However, she compensates for this with amazing physical strength and talent with all sorts of cursed tools. She is voiced by Mikako Komatsu (Japanese) and Allegra Clark (English).Toge Inumaki (狗巻棘, Inumaki Toge)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA second-year student who participates in the sister school event. His power is channeled through cursed speech – words imbued with his cursed energy. To ensure that his abilities don't affect people in everyday situations, he only uses words that can be fillings for rice balls. He is voiced by Koki Uchiyama (Japanese) and Xander Mobus (English).Panda (パンダ, Panda)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA second-year student who participates in the sister school event with Maki and Toge. Despite his appearance as a full-sized panda, he can speak like a human and is also an exceptionally powerful sorcerer. He is voiced by Tomokazu Seki (Japanese) and Matthew David Rudd (English). – Jujutsu High facultySatoru Gojo (五条悟, Gojō Satoru)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA powerful sorcerer and teacher who mentors Yuji, Megumi and Nobara. After Yuji is sentenced to death for being possessed by Sukuna, Satoru proposes that they wait until all of the fingers are consumed, which would give them the chance to destroy Sukuna once and for all. He is renowned for his immense power and battle prowess to the point that his self-proclamation of being the world’s strongest Jujutsu Sorcerer goes unchallenged. He is voiced by Yuichi Nakamura (Japanese) and Kaiji Tang (English).Masamichi Yaga (夜蛾正道, Yaga Masamichi)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteJujutsu High's principal and a passionate educator who once mentored Gojo. He has the ability to bring dolls to life and control them through his cursed corpse technique. He is voiced by Takaya Kuroda (Japanese) and Keith Silverstein (English). – AntagonistsRyomen Sukuna (両面宿儺, Ryōmen Sukuna)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA legendary curse inhabiting Yuji’s body. Also translated as "Double Faced Specter." Known as the "King of Curses", Sukuna resisted all exorcism attempts, driving sorcerers of centuries ago to cut off and hide his 20 fingers in order to seal his power. His character has roots in Japanese legend, with references to a two-faced, 8-armed and 8-legged man with supernatural strength in Nihon Shoki, the second oldest book of Japanese history. He is voiced by Junichi Suwabe (Japanese), and Ray Chase (English).Suguru Geto (夏油 傑, Getō Suguru)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA Special Grade Jujutsu Sorcerer who wishes to transform the world into a "paradise" that would house sorcerers only. He is voiced by Takahiro Sakurai (Japanese) and Lex Lang (English).Jogo (漏瑚, Jōgo)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA powerful curse born of fear of the earth. He believes that his own kind is humanity's true form because cursed spirits originate from pure emotion, as opposed to humans and their false emotions. He is voiced by Shigeru Chiba (Japanese) and Michael Sorich (English).Hanami (花御, Hanami)Source: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteA powerful curse born of fear of the forests. They wish to eliminate humans so they stop hurting the environment. They are voiced by Atsuko Tanaka. Keywords – Curses (呪い, noroi) / Cursed Spirits (呪霊, jurei) Spiritual beings given form by cursed energy (see below). Particularly likely to manifest in places like hospitals and schools, they are the cause of countless mysterious deaths and disappearances in general society, with regular people unable to see them. However, Jujutsu Sorcerers are able to see, fight and exorcise them. Curses vary greatly in appearance and power, and are ranked by strength with Grades 1-4 (4 being the weakest) and Special Grade (the very strongest). They may also be sealed in artifacts as Sukuna was, becoming cursed objects (呪物, jubutsu) that can still emit cursed energy.  – Cursed Energy (呪力, juryoku)A form of energy that arises from humans’ negative emotions, like hate, regret, and shame, and gives form to curses. While regular people are unable to control it, Jujutsu Sorcerers (see below) and curses are able to harness their own cursed energy for combat.  – Jujutsu Sorcerer (呪術師, jujutsu-shi)Individuals who have been trained to combat curses using Jujutsu spells and techniques at one of Japan’s two recognized Jujutsu educational institutions. They are tasked with various missions, the difficulty of which should match their grade as a sorcerer, with Grade 4 being the lowest and Special Grade being the highest. These duties may involve exorcising curses, investigating curse-related incidents, and so on.  – Tokyo Prefectural Jujutsu High School (東京都立呪術高等専門学校, Tōkyo Toritsu Jujutsu Senmon Gakkō)A 4-year institution where aspiring Jujutsu Sorcerers gather to train their craft. It can also be translated as Tokyo Metropolitan Magic Technical School and abbreviated as Jujutsu High. One of Japan’s only two Jujutsu schools, it is located in the suburbs of Tokyo, with the other (its sister school) located in Kyoto. However, it is disguised as a religious school and is further hidden and protected from outside threats by a protective barrier. It is common for fully-fledged sorcerers to come back to Jujutsu High to teach students, as well as manage and support missions. Main media MangaSource: Jujutsu Kaisen official websiteWritten and illustrated by Gege Akutami,  Jujutsu Kaisen first began serialization in  Weekly Shonen Jump in March 2018. Before this, however, a 4-chapter series titled Tokyo Metropolitan Curse Technical School ran in Jump GIGA. Featuring a different main character named Yuta, it was published as a single volume titled  Jujutsu Kaisen 0. Still ongoing with 15 volumes as of March 2021, the main series is one of the best-selling manga series of all time. Over 30 million copies are in circulation (including digital releases) as of February 2021. English translations are currently available online through Shueisha’s Manga Plus app and website. It's also been released in print for North America through Viz Media. Get a peek at the manga here! TV Anime SeriesThe MAPPA-produced anime series debuted in Japan on October 3, 2020 and is slated to run for 24 episodes over two seasons. Directed by Sunghoo Park and written by Hiroshi Seko, it covers the manga's story up to roughly Volume 7. For countries outside of Asia,  Jujutsu Kaisen is available to stream through Crunchyroll. Check out the first episode below!As well as dynamic animation, there are also four theme songs to enjoy: "Kaikai Kitan" by Eve (first opening theme), "Lost in Paradise feat. AKLO" by ALI (first ending theme), "Vivid Vice" by Who-ya Extended (second opening theme), and "Give it Back" by Cö Shu Nie (second ending theme). Get started with "Kaikai Kitan" below! Anime FilmMAPPA is producing an anime film titled  Gekijoban Jujutsu Kaisen 0 ( Jujutsu Kaisen 0: The Movie ). Set for release in winter 2021, the film's story will be based on Tokyo Metropolitan Curse Technical School, the 4-chapter prequel series that was also published in a volume as  Jujutsu Kaisen 0.Source: Jujutsu Kaisen film's official websiteFeel like a bigger taste of  Jujutsu Kaisen? Sit down, maybe get yourself a (hopefully non-finger shaped) snack, and head on your first mission with Yuji! Data: MAPPA is producing an anime film titled  Gekijoban Jujutsu Kaisen 0 ( Jujutsu Kaisen 0: The Movie ). Set for release in winter 2021, the film's story will be based on Tokyo Metropolitan Curse Technical School, the 4-chapter prequel series that was also published in a volume as  Jujutsu Kaisen 0.

Title: Date A Live IV Reveals Trailer Featuring Ending Theme! | Anime News | Tokyo Otaku Mode (TOM) Shop: Figures & Merch From Japan
Data: Tokyo Otaku ModeShopNewsGalleryOtapediaLog InSign UpFEATUREDANIMEMANGAMOVIEEVENTFIGUREARTCOSPLAYJAPANHOW TOFASHIONPRODUCTGAMEMUSICPRESS RELEASEDate A Live IV Reveals Trailer Featuring Ending Theme!ANIMEMar. 28, 2022 02:45Popular anime  Date A Live has released a new trailer that features the Season 4 ending theme, "S.O.S" by sweet ARMS!Based on the light novel series written by Tachibana Koushi and illustrated by Tsunako,  Date A Live follows high school boy Itsuka Shido, who proves unexpectedly irresistible to extraterrestrial spirits set on causing chaos on Earth.It was first adapted into a TV anime in 2013, with the second and third season airing in 2014 and 2019 respectively. The franchise also received an anime film in 2015. Title: Best of TOM News 2021! | Featured News | Tokyo Otaku Mode (TOM) Shop: Figures & Merch From Japan
Data: Tokyo Otaku ModeShopNewsGalleryOtapediaLog InSign UpFEATUREDANIMEMANGAMOVIEEVENTFIGUREARTCOSPLAYJAPANHOW TOFASHIONPRODUCTGAMEMUSICPRESS RELEASEBest of TOM News 2021!FEATUREDJan. 3, 2022 06:55Hi there! It's been a few days since we've said hello to 2022, but we don't want to forget the great anime news we heard in 2021 just yet! That's why we put together a selection of TOM News articles that our readers loved. 2021 was a busy year, so perhaps some will be new to you - on the other hand, if you've already seen all of them, thank you for being such a great reader!First, we have five articles on huge announcements for manga, anime, and more. After that, you'll find five of our original articles, with some appearances from our very own TOM Senpais. Simply click on each title or thumbnail to check them out! TOM News ☆ Bleach One-Shot Manga Debuts With Epic Cliffhanger!20 years after  Bleach burst onto the scene, it blew our minds again with a one-shot titled New Breathes From Hell! We won't spoil the ending for you if you haven't read it, but it's well worth a look. We're still pondering over the huge questions it poses for the future of Ichigo and his friends... ☆ The Saga of Tanya the Evil Season 2 Confirmed!We may not have any more details on Season 2 yet, but TOM News readers were clearly as pumped as we were to hear that Tanya will be back! Hopefully, we'll be hearing more soon. ☆ Hell's Paradise: Jigokuraku Gets TV Anime Adaptation!Yuji Kaku's manga ended this January after a three-year run, but at least we won't be saying goodbye completely! Not to mention, the series will be animated by MAPPA, the studio behind hit series like  Jujutsu Kaisen and  Dorohedoro, not to mention the final season of  Attack on Titan. Have you seen the trailer yet? ☆ Hatsune Miku to Get "Mikuverse" With Animated Series and More!Just when we thought Miku couldn't get any bigger, she surprised us yet again with an upcoming "Mikuverse!" Be sure to check out what's to come if you haven't already. ☆ Spirited Away Stage Adaptation Confirms Main Cast!Stage plays are a huge industry in Japan, but we never expected this beloved Ghibli film would be the next one! It'll premiere early next year, so we're pumped to find out what  Spirited Away will look like in a new medium. TOM Original Articles ☆ WonHobby 33 Photo ReportWe definitely haven't been taking anime and figure-related events for granted this year, so we were thrilled to give you a peek at Good Smile Company and Max Factory's WonHobby 33. Looking back now, you might recognize a few prototypes that have since been released as gorgeous new figures... ☆ I Saw Kimetsu no Yaiba: Mugen Train 16 Times - Here Are 9 Reasons You Have to See It!Well, the title says it all! This article was created with the love and devotion of our resident KNY expert, so even if you aren't a fan of the series, this might just convince you. ☆ Hatsune Miku Chronicle Event ReportMiku is such a huge presence that it's easy to forget she officially came into the world only 14 years ago. If you want to look back with us, check out the event, which chronicles her impressive background! ☆ Beginner's Guide to Jujutsu Kaisen!Okay, you can be honest - raise your hand if you haven't read/watched  Jujutsu Kaisen yet. Maybe you've been occupied with other things or just don't feel like starting a new series, but if you have a spare moment, feel free to take our crash course! ☆ How to Photograph Figures: Teach Me, TOM Senpai!One of our TOM Senpais, who happens to be a wizard at photography, created this awesome guide in the lead-up to our 3rd Figure Photo Contest, but it definitely applies all year round!Thanks for making it to the end! We had a lot of fun bringing all of these articles to you, so we're looking forward to a lot more TOM News in 2022! This is a Tokyo Otaku Mode original article.AnimeBLEACHDemon Slayer: Kimetsu no YaibaFiguresFigures & DollsHatsune MikuJujutsu KaisenMangaNewsSaga of Tanya the EvilSpirited AwayTokyo Otaku ModeundefinedundefinedundefinedundefinedundefinedundefinedundefinedundefinedundefinedundefinedundefinedYou belong in the TOM Fan Club. Don't keep TOM Senpai waiting: https://otakumode.com/fb/8iz  Related ArticlesANIMESend Off 2021 Laughing! 8 Comedy Anime Recommendations: Teach Me, TOM Senpai!From pervy to black humor, romcom to even nonsensical gibberish, there's something for you! | Send Off 2021 Laughing! 8 Comedy Anime Recommended by Tokyo Otaku Mode Staff Members: Teach Me, TOM Senpai!4 months agoANIMEBiggest Japanese Culture Shock Moments Experienced by TOM's Foreign Staff: Teach Me, TOM Senpai!From naps to water bottles, can you relate to any of these culture shock moments? | Biggest Japanese Culture Shock Moments Experienced by TOM's Foreign Staff: Teach Me, TOM Senpai!11 months agoJAPANDid You Know Fruit Sandwiches Are a Japanese Invention?!: Teach Me, TOM Senpai!Have you heard about these adorable treats? | Did You Know That Fruit Sandwiches Are a Japanese Invention?!: Teach Me, TOM Senpai!11 months agoJAPANTop 10 Japanese Souvenirs We Bought For Our Loved Ones: Teach Me, TOM Senpai!If you're ever stuck on what Japanese souvenirs to bring home, the TOM Shop's foreign staff is here to help! | Top 10 Japanese Souvenirs We Bought for Our Loved Ones: Teach Me, TOM Senpai!11 months agoFollow UsStay connected onPrevious StoryANIMEThe Irregular at Magic High School to Get Sequel Anime!3 months agoNext StoryANIMEJujutsu Kaisen 0 Unleashes New Visual!3 months agoBack to topAbout UsWhat is Tokyo Otaku Mode?TOM PremiumLetter From the FounderOur PromiseCorporate Site (Japanese) LEGALTerms of UsePrivacy PolicyMerchandise PolicyHelpTOM Shop FAQTOM Premium FAQTokyo Otaku Mode FAQContact UsMore InfoSite MapTOM Email ArchivesKeyword RankingWhat is a Special Creator?AdvertiseOur Business PartnersIcon and BannerOtapediaOther SiteTOM Shop AppsRecommended SiteMyAnimeListHoney’s AnimeAnime Anime globalTokyo Otaku Mode (TOM)

After that, you'll find five of our original articles, with some appearances from our very own TOM Senpais. Simply click on each title or thumbnail to check them out! TOM News ☆ Bleach One-Shot Manga Debuts With Epic Cliffhanger!20 years after  Bleach burst onto the scene, it blew our minds again with a one-shot titled New Breathes From Hell! We won't spoil the ending for you if you haven't read it, but it's well worth a look. We're still pondering over the huge questions it poses for the future of Ichigo and his friends... ☆ The Saga of Tanya the Evil Season 2 Confirmed!We may not have any more details on Season 2 yet, but TOM News readers were clearly as pumped as we were to hear that Tanya will be back! Hopefully, we'll be hearing more soon. ☆ Hell's Paradise: Jigokuraku Gets TV Anime Adaptation!Yuji Kaku's manga ended this January after a three-year run, but at least we won't be saying goodbye completely! Not to mention, the series will be animated by MAPPA, the studio behind hit series like  Jujutsu Kaisen and  Dorohedoro, not to mention the final season of  Attack on Titan. Have you seen the trailer yet? ☆ Hatsune Miku to Get "Mikuverse" With Animated Series and More!Just when we thought Miku couldn't get any bigger, she surprised us yet again with an upcoming "Mikuverse!" Be sure to check out what's to come if you haven't already. ☆ Spirited Away Stage Adaptation Confirms Main Cast!Stage plays are a huge industry in Japan, but we never expected this beloved Ghibli film would be the next one! TOM Original Articles ☆ WonHobby 33 Photo ReportWe definitely haven't been taking anime and figure-related events for granted this year, so we were thrilled to give you a peek at Good Smile Company and Max Factory's WonHobby 33. If you want to look back with us, check out the event, which chronicles her impressive background! ☆ Beginner's Guide to Jujutsu Kaisen!Okay, you can be honest - raise your hand if you haven't read/watched  Jujutsu Kaisen yet. Maybe you've been occupied with other things or just don't feel like starting a new series, but if you have a spare moment, feel free to take our crash course! ☆ How to Photograph Figures: Teach Me, TOM Senpai!One of our TOM Senpais, who happens to be a wizard at photography, created this awesome guide in the lead-up to our 3rd Figure Photo Contest, but it definitely applies all year round!Thanks for making it to the end! We had a lot of fun bringing all of these articles to you, so we're looking forward to a lot more TOM News in 2022! That's why we put together a selection of TOM News articles that our readers loved. 2021 was a busy year, so perhaps some will be new to you - on the other hand, if you've already seen all of them, thank you for being such a great reader!First, we have five articles on huge announcements for manga, anime, and more. After that, you'll find five of our original articles, with some appearances from our very own TOM Senpais. Simply click on each title or thumbnail to check them out! TOM News ☆ Bleach One-Shot Manga Debuts With Epic Cliffhanger!20 years after  Bleach burst onto the scene, it blew our minds again with a one-shot titled New Breathes From Hell! We won't spoil the ending for you if you haven't read it, but it's well worth a look. We're still pondering over the huge questions it poses for the future of Ichigo and his friends... ☆ The Saga of Tanya the Evil Season 2 Confirmed!We may not have any more details on Season 2 yet, but TOM News readers were clearly as pumped as we were to hear that Tanya will be back! Hopefully, we'll be hearing more soon. ☆ Hell's Paradise: Jigokuraku Gets TV Anime Adaptation!Yuji Kaku's manga ended this January after a three-year run, but at least we won't be saying goodbye completely! Not to mention, the series will be animated by MAPPA, the studio behind hit series like  Jujutsu Kaisen and  Dorohedoro, not to mention the final season of  Attack on Titan. Have you seen the trailer yet? ☆ Hatsune Miku to Get "Mikuverse" With Animated Series and More!Just when we thought Miku couldn't get any bigger, she surprised us yet again with an upcoming "Mikuverse!" Be sure to check out what's to come if you haven't already. ☆ Spirited Away Stage Adaptation Confirms Main Cast!Stage plays are a huge industry in Japan, but we never expected this beloved Ghibli film would be the next one! It'll premiere early next year, so we're pumped to find out what  Spirited Away will look like in a new medium. TOM Original Articles ☆ WonHobby 33 Photo ReportWe definitely haven't been taking anime and figure-related events for granted this year, so we were thrilled to give you a peek at Good Smile Company and Max Factory's WonHobby 33. Looking back now, you might recognize a few prototypes that have since been released as gorgeous new figures... ☆ I Saw Kimetsu no Yaiba: Mugen Train 16 Times - Here Are 9 Reasons You Have to See It!Well, the title says it all! This article was created with the love and devotion of our resident KNY expert, so even if you aren't a fan of the series, this might just convince you. ☆ Hatsune Miku Chronicle Event ReportMiku is such a huge presence that it's easy to forget she officially came into the world only 14 years ago. Maybe you've been occupied with other things or just don't feel like starting a new series, but if you have a spare moment, feel free to take our crash course! ☆ How to Photograph Figures: Teach Me, TOM Senpai!One of our TOM Senpais, who happens to be a wizard at photography, created this awesome guide in the lead-up to our 3rd Figure Photo Contest, but it definitely applies all year round!Thanks for making it to the end! This article was created with the love and devotion of our resident KNY expert, so even if you aren't a fan of the series, this might just convince you. ☆ Hatsune Miku Chronicle Event ReportMiku is such a huge presence that it's easy to forget she officially came into the world only 14 years ago. If you want to look back with us, check out the event, which chronicles her impressive background! ☆ Beginner's Guide to Jujutsu Kaisen!Okay, you can be honest - raise your hand if you haven't read/watched  Jujutsu Kaisen yet. Maybe you've been occupied with other things or just don't feel like starting a new series, but if you have a spare moment, feel free to take our crash course! ☆ How to Photograph Figures: Teach Me, TOM Senpai!One of our TOM Senpais, who happens to be a wizard at photography, created this awesome guide in the lead-up to our 3rd Figure Photo Contest, but it definitely applies all year round!Thanks for making it to the end! We had a lot of fun bringing all of these articles to you, so we're looking forward to a lot more TOM News in 2022! This is a Tokyo Otaku Mode original article.

Title: Best of TOM News 2021! | Featured News | Tokyo Otaku Mode (TOM) Shop: Figures & Merch From Japan
Data: Hi there! It's been a few days since we've said hello to 2022, but we don't want to forget the great anime news we heard in 2021 just yet! That's why we put together a selection of TOM News articles that our readers loved. 2021 was a busy year, so perhaps some will be new to you - on the other hand, if you've already seen all of them, thank you for being such a great reader!

Title: Best of TOM News 2021! | Featured News | Tokyo Otaku Mode (TOM) Shop: Figures & Merch From Japan
Data: We definitely haven't been taking anime and figure-related events for granted this year, so we were thrilled to give you a peek at Good Smile Company and Max Factory's WonHobby 33. Looking back now, you might recognize a few prototypes that have since been released as gorgeous new figures...

Title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Stone Ocean to Return in Fall 2022 | Anime News | Tokyo Otaku Mode (TOM) Shop: Figures & Merch From Japan
Data: Tokyo Otaku ModeShopNewsGalleryOtapediaLog InSign UpFEATUREDANIMEMANGAMOVIEEVENTFIGUREARTCOSPLAYJAPANHOW TOFASHIONPRODUCTGAMEMUSICPRESS RELEASEJoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Stone Ocean Anime to Return in Fall 2022!ANIMEMar. 26, 2022 09:33Source: Netflix Anime TwitterPopular anime  JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Stone Ocean will be back with Part 2 this fall!The anime's next 12 episodes will premiere worldwide exclusively on Netflix. A new visual and a second trailer subtitled in English were also revealed. An ongoing manga series by Hirohiko Araki,  JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure follows members of the Joestar family through successive generations in a world where one’s spiritual energy can be manifested as a “Stand.”Season 5, titled  JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure: Stone Ocean, takes place in Port St. Lucie, Florida in 2011. The story follows Jolyne Cujoh, the estranged daughter of Jotaro Kujo, who is framed for a murder she did not commit.Part 1 premiered on Netflix in December 2021 with 12 episodes.  JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure: Stone Ocean Part 2 will stream worldwide exclusively on Netflix from fall 2022. Title: Jujutsu Kaisen Reveals New Visual! | Anime News | Tokyo Otaku Mode (TOM) Shop: Figures & Merch From Japan
Data: Tokyo Otaku ModeShopNewsGalleryOtapediaLog InSign UpFEATUREDANIMEMANGAMOVIEEVENTFIGUREARTCOSPLAYJAPANHOW TOFASHIONPRODUCTGAMEMUSICPRESS RELEASEJujutsu Kaisen Reveals New Visual!ANIMEMar. 26, 2022 08:17Hit fantasy anime  Jujutsu Kaisen has revealed a new visual!The visual was unveiled to mark the upcoming rebroadcast of the first season in Japan, which will begin on April 3, 2022. Created by Gege Akutami,  Jujutsu Kaisen follows Yuji, a high school boy who chooses to join the Occult Research Club, despite his exceptional talent for athletics. When a cursed talisman is accidentally unsealed, Yuji swallows it and becomes the host of the curse, which he must carry until he is able to kill it along with himself.The manga was first serialized in March 2018, going on to receive a 24-episode TV anime series that aired from October 2020 to March 2021. Season 2 will air in winter 2023. Adapted with permission from Anime!Anime!AnimeJujutsu KaisenNewsundefinedYou belong in the TOM Fan Club. Title: Spring 2022 Anime Roundup! | Featured News | Tokyo Otaku Mode (TOM) Shop: Figures & Merch From Japan
Data: Tokyo Otaku ModeShopNewsGalleryOtapediaLog InSign UpFEATUREDANIMEMANGAMOVIEEVENTFIGUREARTCOSPLAYJAPANHOW TOFASHIONPRODUCTGAMEMUSICPRESS RELEASESpring 2022 Anime Roundup!FEATUREDMar. 17, 2022 07:03Source: Kaguya-sama: Love is War websiteIt's that time of the year - spring has sprung in Tokyo, meaning new beginnings, new experiences, and of course, plenty of new anime! If you haven't been keeping up, then fear not. Here, we have release dates, trailers, and plots for the upcoming season's anime series so that you can browse through at your leisure. We'll kick things off with sequel anime (new seasons and cours) and then move onto new anime. Whether you're looking for action-packed adventures, romcom romps, or superhero shenanigans, there's bound to be something for you! Contents1. Sequel Anime2. New Anime – Sequel Anime ☆ The Rising of the Shield Hero Season 2Release: April 6Studio: DR Movie, Kinema CitrusIwatani Naofumi, a run-of-the-mill otaku, finds a book in the library that summons him to another world. He is tasked with joining the sword, spear, and bow as one of the Four Cardinal Heroes and fighting the Waves of Catastrophe as the Shield Hero. Excited by the prospect of a grand adventure, Naofumi sets off with his party. However, merely a few days later, he is betrayed and loses all his money, dignity, and respect. Unable to trust anyone anymore, he employs a slave named Raphtalia and takes on the Waves and the world. But will he really find a way to overturn this desperate situation? Source: Crunchyroll ☆ Kaguya-sama: Love is War: Ultra Romantic (Season 3)Release: April 9Studio: A-1 PicturesFrom a good family? Check! A good personality? Check! Shuchiin Academy is where all these elite students with bright futures flock to. As the two leaders of the student council, Kaguya Shinomiya and Miyuki Shirogane have supposedly fallen in love… But after almost half a year, nothing has happened!? They both have too much pride and can’t be honest. Things have gotten troublesome, and they are now caught in a war of "How to get the other to confess their love first." This is a whole new romantic comedy, following an outbreak of cunning warfare between two elite students in love.Source: Crunchyroll ☆ Date A Live IVRelease: April 8Studio: GEEKTOYSOrdinary high school boy Shido discovers a mysterious girl at ground zero of a recent spacequake. Shido learns, through his sister Kotori, that the girl is one of the Spirits: mystical creatures responsible for the spacequakes. Shido is recruited to help “seal” the sprits and end their threat to mankind. There’s just one catch: the only way to seal a spirit—is to make her fall in love with you.Source: Crunchyroll ☆ Komi Can't Communicate Season 2Release: April 7Studio: OLMAt a high school full of unique characters, Tadano helps his shy and unsociable classmate Komi reach her goal of making friends with 100 people.Source: Netflix ☆ Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka☆Magica Gaiden Final SeasonRelease: April 3Studio: ShaftIn exchange for the fulfillment of a wish, Magical Girls keep fighting, unbeknownst to the rest of the world. But Iroha Tamaki can’t seem to remember her wish. "When I became a Magical Girl, what did I wish for again?" There is a gaping hole in her life. Something important has been lost. But she continues to fight every day, without even knowing why… Then, a rumor begins to spread among Magical Girls. "Magical Girls can be saved if they go to Kamihama." Kamihama City, the city where Magical Girls and Uwasa are gathering. The story of Iroha Tamaki, in search of her lost wish, begins…Source: Crunchyroll ☆ Science Fell in Love, So I Tried to Prove It Season 2Release: April 2Studio: Zero-GWhat happens when a science-inclined girl and boy who are deeply passionate about research fall in love? An intelligent woman named Himuro Ayame who is a science graduate student at Saitama University happens to ask fellow science grad student Yukimura Shinya out. Of course, there’s no logical reason for this love! But as a science and engineering major, not being able to logically prove love would mean that those feelings aren’t real, and they’d fail as a science student. With that in mind, the two drag everyone else in the lab into trying various experiments to prove love actually exists.Source: Crunchyroll ☆ Ascendance of a Bookworm Season 3Release: April 12Studio: Ajia-DoAvid bookworm and college student Motosu Urano ends up dying in an unforeseen accident. This came right after the news that she would finally be able to work as a librarian like she had always dreamed of. When she regained consciousness, she was reborn as Main, the daughter of a poor soldier. She was in the town of Ehrenfest, which had a harsh class system. But as long as she had books, she didn't really need anything else. However, books were scarce and belonged only to the nobles. But that doesn't stop her, so she makes a decision... "If there aren't any books, I'll just create some."Source: Crunchyroll ☆ The Demon Girl Next Door 2-Chome (Season 2)Release: April 8Studio: J.C.StaffYuko Yoshida is just an ordinary schoolgirl — until one day the demon Lilith unleashes her dormant, devilish powers! Yuko transforms into Shadow Mistress Yuko, a supernatural powerhouse with horns and a devil tail. Now she must defeat another mystical being named Momo Chiyoda, the shrine maiden of the Light Clan who just so happens to go to Yuko’s school! But being a demonic magical girl isn’t as easy as it looks, and Yuko has a lot to learn before she’s ready to fulfill her destiny.Source: Sentai Filmworks ☆ Kingdom Season 4Release: April 10Studio: Pierrot, Studio SignpostShin and Hyou are war-orphans in the kingdom of Qin. They dream of proving themselves on the battlefield until the day Hyou is captured by a minister. The boy manages to escape and return to his village, but he is badly injured. Shin then meets a mysterious youth who bears an eerie resemblance to Hyou—a boy who will one day become emperor!Source: Crunchyroll ☆ Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club Season 2Release: April 2Studio: SunriseNijigasaki High School is known for their diverse subjects and the freedom they give to students. Second-year student Yu Takasaki has been turned on to the charms of school idols, so she knocks on the door of the School Idol Club with her friend, Ayumu Uehara. Sometimes friends, sometimes rivals, the members of this club each contribute their own thoughts and motivations to the group.Source: Crunchyroll ☆ Yatogame-chan Kansatsu Nikki Season 4Release: AprilStudio: Hayabusa FilmSource: Yatogame-chan Kansatsu Nikki TwitterAfter growing up in Tokyo, high school student Jin Kaito moves to Nagoya where he meets Yatogame Monaka, a fellow student who puts her Nagoya dialect on full display. With her cat-like appearance and unvarnished Nagoya dialect, Yatogame won't open up to him at all. This popular local comedy is increasing the status of Nagoya through observation of the adorable Yatogame-chan!Source: Crunchyroll ☆ KAGI-NADO Season 2Release: AprilStudio: Liden Films Kyoto StudioSource: KAGI-NADO TwitterThis is the story of a small miracle. Stars from different universes and different times that were never meant to cross paths. By irony of fate, these stars come together in “Kaginado Academy”. What awaits them there is a lively school life full of hope and dreams. The wonderful encounters provide the stars with new radiance. What awaits beyond that radiance...?Source: Crunchyroll ☆ Amaim Warrior at the Borderline Part 2Release: AprilStudio: Sunrise BeyondIt’s 2061, and the nation of Japan lies under the jackboots of economic bloc world tyrants. Its people scrape by to survive while hiding from AMAIM mech enforcers. But destiny smiles on introverted mechanic Shiiba Amou when he finds the AI, I-LeS Gai—the final key needed to power his own unit. Can this young freedom fighter spark the flames of rebellion for his beloved country and free its people?Source: Funimation ☆ Tiger & Bunny 2Release: April 8Studio: SunriseMismatched hero duo Wild Tiger and Barnaby lead the way in keeping the peace and getting sponsors as heroes from around the world enter the fray.Source: Netflix Anime ☆ Build Divide -#FFFFFF- Code White (Season 2)Release: April 3Studio: Liden FilmsIn a city where the King reigns supreme, your strength in Build-Divide determines everything... There is a rumor circulating in Shin Kyoto. "Anyone able to defeat the King in Build-Divide shall be granted whatever their heart desires." In order to challenge the King, one must first enter the battle known as Rebuild. There, they will have to complete the "Key." The young Teruto Kurabe vows to defeat the King so that he can get what he longs for. He, with a little guidance from the mysterious Sakura Banka, dives headfirst into the Rebuild Battle.Source: Crunchyroll – New Anime ☆ Shikimori's Not Just a CutieRelease: April 9Studio: Doga KoboThe ultimate "heartthrob girlfriend" appears! Naturally unlucky high school student Izumi's girlfriend is his classmate Shikimori. She has a beautiful smile and kind personality and always seems happy when she's with Izumi. She's a pretty, cute, and loving girlfriend, but when Izumi's in trouble… she transforms into a super cool "heartthrob girlfriend!" The fun lives of the cute and cool Shikimori, Izumi, and their good friends never end! This 1000% precious romantic comedy begins now!Source: Crunchyroll ☆ Spy x FamilyRelease: April 9Studio: Wit Studio, CloverWorksA spy who goes by the codename "Twilight" is ordered to create a fake family to facilitate his latest mission. Unbeknownst to him, however, the woman he chooses as his “wife” is actually an assassin, the little girl he “adopts” is a telepath, and even the family dog has the ability to predict the future. ☆ Black Rock Shooter: Dawn FallRelease: April 3Studio: Bibury Animation CG, Bibury Animation StudiosA new anime series from the  Black Rock Shooter franchise, which began with a series of illustrations by Ryohei Fuke (also known as huke) and expanded into a hit song by Supercell’s Ryo, manga, anime and games. While each version takes place in a different universe, they all revolve around Black Rock Shooter, a young woman with dark hair and a flaming blue eye who carries a rapid-fire, high speed cannon. ☆ A Couple of CuckoosRelease: AprilStudio: SynergySP, Shin-Ei Animation16-year-old super-studier Nagi Umino, second-year student at the Meguro River Academy high school, was switched at birth. On his way to a dinner to meet his birth parents, he accidentally meets the brash, outspoken, Erika Amano, who is determined to make Nagi her fake boyfriend as she never wants to actually marry. But once Nagi makes it to dinner, he finds his parents have decided to resolve the hospital switch by conveniently having him marry the daughter his birth parents raised...who turns out to be none other than Erika herself!Source: Kodansha USA ☆ Summer Time RenderingRelease: April 15Studio: OLMA tragic incident calls a young man named Shinpei back to his hometown on the remote island of Higotoshima, Japan. But something sinister awaits upon his return, and a chilling sequence of events unfolds that will have dire consequences for Shinpei, for Japan, and for the entire world!Source: Udon Entertainment ☆ Skeleton Knight in Another WorldRelease: April 7Studio: HORNETS, Studio KaiWhen Arc wakes up, he discovers that he has been transported to another world in the body of the character he was playing in an MMO. Looking like a suit of armor on the outside and a skeleton on the inside, he is the Skeleton Knight. If his identity is discovered, he could be mistaken for a monster and become a target! Arc decides to spend his time as a mercenary so as not to attract attention to himself. However, he's not the kind of man who can stand idly by when he witnesses evil acts take place right before his eyes! This isekai fantasy series about the Skeleton Knight's unintentional quest to make the world a better place has arrived!!Source: Crunchyroll ☆ Aharen-san wa HakarenaiRelease: April 2, 2022Studio: Felix FilmA romantic comedy following the friendship between Reina Aharen, a high school girl who struggles with interpersonal boundaries, and Raido Matsuboshi, the kind-hearted boy who sits next to her. ☆ AoashiRelease: April 9Studio: Production I.GAshito Aoi is a young, aspiring soccer player from a backwater town in Japan. His hopes of getting into a high school with a good soccer club are dashed when he causes an incident during a critical match for his team, which results in their loss and elimination from the tournament. Nevertheless, he catches the eye of someone important who happened to be visiting from Tokyo. How will things turn out for Ashito?Source: Shogakukan Asia ☆ Love After World DominationRelease: April 8Studio: Project No.9In a world of superheroes and villains, Fudo Aikawa leads the Gelato Five as his heroic alter ego Red Gelato. However, what everyone doesn't know is that he and Desumi Magahara, the leader of secret evil organization Gekko, have inconveniently fallen for each other and are now in a loving relationship... ☆ Love All PlayRelease: April 2Studio: Nippon Animation, OLMDespite a lack of proper instruction, junior high school student Ryo Mizushima makes it to the prefectural tournaments for badminton and catches the eye of Coach Ebihara from the prestigious Yokohama Minato High School. Spurred on by his new coach and talented teammates, Ryo begins to aim for victory at the inter-high tournament.  ☆ I'm Quitting HeroingRelease: April 5Studio: EMT SquaredAfter saving humanity from the despicable Demon King, Leo Demonhart does not earn a hero’s standing. Instead, he is regarded with suspicion and hostility by those he fought to protect. Treated as a pariah with nowhere else to turn, exiled Leo seeks a position in the army of his former nemesis! But the army is not what it once was before its defeat at Leo’s hands, so to maintain his new position, Leo must whip the forces back into fighting shape.Source: Sentai Filmworks ☆ The Executioner and Her Way of LifeRelease: April 2Studio: Egg Firm, SB CreativeThe Lost Ones are wanderers who come here from a distant world known as "Japan." No one knows how or why they leave their homes. The only thing that is certain is that they bring disaster and calamity. The duty of exterminating them without remorse falls to Menou, a young Executioner. When she meets Akari, it seems like just another job...until she discovers it's impossible to kill this girl! And when Menou begins to search for a way to defeat this immortality, Akari is more than happy to tag along! So begins a journey that will change Menou forever...Source: Yen Press ☆ The Dawn of the WitchRelease: April 8Studio: Tezuka ProductionsSaybil is a magic student with no memories of his life before he met a mysterious silver-haired woman in an alley. Now he travels with his teacher, Loux—another student, Holt, and the beastfallen Kudo for "special training"... but this field trip may not be as routine as it seems!Source: Kodansha USA ☆ Tomodachi GameRelease: April 6Studio: Okuruto NoboruHigh school student Katagiri Yuichi, who values friendship above all else, enjoys a fulfilling life with his close friends Sawagiri Shiho, Mikasa Tenji, Shibe Makoto, and Kokorogi Yutori.However, after a particular incident, they're dragged into a debt repayment game.The only way to beat the "Tomodachi Game" is to not doubt their friends. Bound together by solid friendships, the game should've been easy, but– The hugely popular comic that sold over two million copies is finally becoming an anime! Will they trust or betray their precious friends? The true nature of humanity is exposed in the ultimate psychological game!Source: Crunchyroll ☆ DeaimonRelease: April 6Studio: Encourage FilmsAfter 10 years spent chasing his dreams in Tokyo, Nagomu Irino receives word that his father is sick and returns to Kyoto to take over the family business, a wagashi (traditional Japanese sweets) shop. There, his mother expects him to fill the role of a parent to a young girl named Itsuka Yukihira, who has declared that she'll be the one to take over the shop. Although she initially views Nagomu with hostility, she begins reveals a different side to her as they work together.  ☆ Heroine Tarumono!: Kiraware Heroine to Naisho no OshigotoRelease: April 7Studio: Lay-duceHiyori Suzumi leaves the country for Tokyo in hopes of joining the track and field team at her new school, only to be drawn into the world of idols by her new classmates - Yujiro Someya and Aizo Shibasaki, members of idol group LIPxLIP. In addition to her busy new life as a high school student, she must now face the challenges of being a junior idol manager. ☆ Ya Boy Kongming!Release: April 5Studio: P.A. WorksFate and reincarnation deliver brilliant military strategist, Kongming, from warring, ancient China to Japan’s modern party hot spot in Shibuya City, Tokyo. After a lifetime of battles and military skirmishes, Kongming wished with his last breath to be reborn in a world of peace and prosperity. It’s nearly two millennia later and he’s finding his way in a very different world than that of his past life. When he meets Eiko, an amateur musician with big dreams, the unlikely duo strikes up an even unlikelier friendship. Eiko has street smarts to help Kongming navigate this strange new world, and Kongming will use his strategic mind to help Eiko achieve stardom!Source: Sentai Filmworks ☆ Trapped in a Dating Sim: The World of Otome Games is Tough for MobsRelease: April 3Studio: ENGIOffice worker Leon is reincarnated into a dating sim video game, where women reign supreme and only beautiful men have a seat at the table. But Leon has a secret weapon: he remembers everything from his past life, which includes a complete playthrough of the very game in which he is now trapped. Can Leon spark a revolution to change this new world order?Source: Seven Seas Entertainment ☆ The Greatest Demon Lord Is Reborn as a Typical NobodyRelease: April 6Studio: Blade, SILVER LINK.The most powerful Demon Lord in history, Varvatos, felt that he had accomplished everything he could as a king. Because he was so alone due to how powerful he was, he longed for a much simpler life. A few millennia later, he is reborn as the villager, Ard Meteor. But in the future where he was reborn, magical civilization had declined and magic itself had become weaker.Ard enrolls into the Academy of Magic with his childhood friend Ireena and no matter how much he tries not to stand out, he can't hide the fact that he is not ordinary.He is constantly surrounded by people awestruck by him, and many try to approach him. Meanwhile, the demons of the world who once struck fear into the hearts of the people have also gone into hiding...Will the former Demon Lord be able to achieve the peaceful and mundane life he's always dreamed of? A heroic academy-life fantasy filled with chaos is about to begin!Source: Crunchyroll ☆ Dance Dance DanseurRelease: April 9Studio: MAPPAAfter the death of his father, a teenage boy named Junpei gives up his dream of becoming a ballet dancer, believing that he must become more masculine. However, the arrival of a transfer student sets him back on the path to become a great dancer. ☆ Fanfare of AdolescenceRelease: April 2Studio: Lay-duceSet in a demanding school that only admits 10 to 20 students per year, Fanfare of Adolescence is a youth drama that follows the lives of three young men - a boy who formerly belonged to an idol group, a boy who was raised on a remote island, and a boy from England whose parents dictate his future for him - as they train to become professional horse racing jockeys. Can they make it through three years of schooling that tests not only their motor skills and academic prowess, but also their physical attributes as well? ☆ Don't Hurt Me, My Healer!Release: April 10Studio: JumondoThe story of the series follows Arvin, a knight with saint-like patience for annoying people, and Karla, a dark elf healer with a sharp tongue and a rotten personality who always speaks without thinking first. Together, they form a party and go on fantastical adventures.Source: Crunchyroll ☆ Shachiku-san wa Yojo Yurei ni Iyasaretai.Release: April 7Studio: Project No.9Corporate slave Fujihara is working late at night when she hears an eerie voice telling her to get out. However, she discovers that instead of a creepy creature, but it's an adorable ghost who simply wants her to rest and live a healthier life! ☆ RPG Real EstateRelease: April 6Studio: Doga KoboIn a fantasy world where it's been 15 years since the demon king was defeated, a young magician named Kotone works as a real estate agent with several unique colleagues, including the mischievous and free-spirited Fa, the monk Rufuria, and the soldier Rakira. ☆ In the Heart of Kunoichi TsubakiRelease: April 10Studio: CloverWorksAn adaptation of a manga series by  Teasing Master Takagi's Soichiro Yamamoto. A talented young kunoichi (female ninja) named Tsubaki lives in a remote village whose inhabitants are absolutely forbidden to have contact with men. However, she can't help but wonder what it would be like to finally meet a man... ☆ Healer GirlRelease: April 4Studio: Studio 3HzIn a world where injuries and ailments are treated by Healers through song, four girls do their best to train their skills as apprentices and bring relief to those around them. ☆ Shin Ikki TousenRelease: March 27Studio: ArmsAn adaptation of the sequel manga to  Ikki Tousen, in which fighters across different schools wear magatama, or sacred beads that hold the essence of warriors from China's Three Kingdom era, thsu bestowing upon its holder the powers and fate of that warrior.  ☆ Birdie Wing: Golf Girls' StoryRelease: April 6Studio: Bandai Namco PicturesAn original anime set in a fictional European country, where a brilliant golfer named Eve earns a living by playing betting games. One fateful day, she witnesses a shot by someone from a completely different walk of life - Aoi Amawashi, an elite golfer who nevertheless plays to enjoy the sport. Thus, they go on to influence each other and develop as fellow golfers.  ☆ Shadowverse FlameRelease: April 2Studio: ZexcsThe second anime adaptation from Cygames'  Shadowverse card game franchise, focusing on Tenryu Light, a beginner who transfers into pro training facility Shadova College.  ☆ Estab-Life: Great EscapeRelease: AprilStudio: Polygon PicturesAn anime set in the world of a mixed-media project led by  Code Geass' Goro Taniguchi, which explores a world where humans also exist in the forms of cyborgs and supernatural beings. Huge walls controlled by artificial intelligence have split Tokyo into areas known as Clusters, leading to unique cultures within each. Although most people live in peace without ever leaving their own Cluster, some don't fit in and dream of moving to another. ☆ Onipan!Release: AprilStudio: Wit StudioIn a world where oni (demons) are no longer feared and coexist with humans, three young oni transfer into a junior high school in an attempt to improve how people see their species with the help of their trusty oni underpants, or "onipan!" ☆ Yu☆Gi☆Oh!: Go Rush!!Release: April 3Studio: BridgeSource: Yu☆Gi☆Oh!: Go Rush!! websiteTwin elementary school students Yuhi and Yuamu Odo run a business that claims to exterminate aliens. Unfortunately, they’re unable to actually find any - that is, until the day they meet Yudias, an alien from a distant star who seeks Rush Duel in hopes of bringing his exiled friends to a new future.Found any new anime to look out for? We definitely have! Our watchlists keep growing and growing, but we'll count that as a good problem to have. Thanks for reading all the way down to here, and see you next time!This is a Tokyo Otaku Mode original article.A Couple of CuckoosAharen-san wa HakarenaiAnimeAoashiAscendance of a BookwormBlack Rock ShooterBuild Divide -#000000 (Code Black)-Date A LiveDate A Live IVDate A Live SeriesDon't Hurt Me, My Healer!Estab-Life: Great EscapeFanfare of AdolescenceIkki TousenIn the Heart of Kunoichi TsubakiKaginadoKaguya-sama: Love is WarKomi Can't CommunicateLove After World DominationLove Live SeriesMagia RecordNijigasaki High School Idol ClubOnipan!Rikei ga Koi ni Ochita no de Shoumei Shite MitaRPG Real EstateShachiku-san wa Yojo Yurei ni IyasaretaiShadowverseShikimori's Not Just a CutieSpy x FamilySummer Time RenderingThe Demon Girl Next DoorThe Executioner and Her Way of LifeThe Greatest Demon Lord Is Reborn as a Typical NobodyThe Rising of the Shield HeroTIGER & BUNNYTrapped in a Dating Sim: The World of Otome Games is Tough for MobsYu-Gi-Oh!undefinedundefinedundefinedundefinedYou belong in the TOM Fan Club.
